{{short description|Mother of Galadriel}} {{infobox character | name=Eärwen | people=[[Falmari|Falmar]] | image=Elena Kukanova - The Swan-Maiden of Alqualonde.jpeg | caption="The Swan-Maiden of Alqualonde" by [[Elena Kukanova]] | pronun=[[Quenya|Q]], {{IPA|[eˈarwen]}} | othernames=Swan-maiden of Alqualondë | titles=Queen of the Noldor | position= | location=[[Alqualondë]] | affiliation= | language=[[Telerin]] | birth=Before {{YT|1280}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Olwë]] | siblings=Unnamed brothers{{S|Princes}}She is said to have at least two brothers according to a passing reference in ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', whose names are not mentioned in the narrative. According to an early genealogy, one of them is named [[Elulindo]]; cf. {{LR|A1}}. | spouse=[[Finarfin]] | children=[[Finrod]], [[Angrod]], [[Aegnor]], and [[Galadriel]] | gender=Female | height= | hair=Starlike silver{{UT|Galadriel}}, p. 230 | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Eärwen''', known as the "swan-maiden of [[Alqualondë]]", was the daughter of [[Olwë]], lord of the [[Teleri]]. == History == In {{YT|1280}},{{AA|85}} she married [[Finarfin]], the youngest prince of the [[House of Finwë]]. She became the mother of [[Finrod]], [[Angrod]], [[Aegnor]], and [[Galadriel]].[[Orodreth]] appears as one of Eärwen's sons in ''[[The Silmarillion]]''. In [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien's]] writings, however, he was clearly marked as [[Angrod]]'s son. Cf. more in [[Orodreth#Other versions of the legendarium]]. She was said to be close friends with [[Anairë]], the wife of [[Fingolfin]], her husband's older brother.{{PM|XI4}}, p. 344 Her children, being also in part [[Sea-elves]], had a love of the sea and a longing for distant places; and it was in part due to this inheritance that all four of Eärwen's children chose to return to [[Middle-earth]], [[Exile of the Noldor|exiling]] themselves from [[Valinor]],{{PM|Case}}, p. 336 although Eärwen herself stayed in [[Aman]]. Because of their [[Teleri]]n blood, Eärwen's children were well received in [[Doriath]], the realm of her father's elder brother, [[Thingol]].{{S|Index}}, entry "Eärwen" == Etymology == {{pronounce|Quenya - Eärwen.mp3|Gilgamesh}} ''Eärwen'' is clearly [[Quenya]]. As [[Paul Strack]] explains, it probably means "Sea-maiden", being a compound of ''[[eär]]'' ("sea") + ''[[wende|-wen]]'' ("maiden").{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2625531453.html|articlename=Q.
